definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR)
pinyin: gong1 min2 quan2 li4 he2 zheng4 zhi4 quan2 li4 guo2 ji4 gong1 yue1
containing_words.word: 公民权利和政治权利国际公约

sentences.english: Being a woman is synonymous with being a second-class citizen, in her opinion.
sentences.chinese: 在她看来，做女人是做二等公民的同义词。

sentences.english: Female citizens may be recruited for active service according to the army's need in accordance with the preceding paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 根据军队需要，可以按前款规定征集女性公民服现役。

sentences.english: Can say, confiscate what bring about pair of citizen money property right directly is privative with limitation.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，没收直接导致对公民财产权的剥夺和限制。

sentences.english: It belongs to the scope of personal liberty and is some.
sentences.chinese: 人身自由是公民全部权利中最基础的和前提性的部分。

sentences.english: Its citizens will also be allowed to travel visa-free in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其公民也被允许免签前往欧洲旅游。

sentences.english: Bahrain's strong civil society fostered a tradition of political activism.
sentences.chinese: 巴林发达的公民社会促成了一种能动的政治传统。

sentences.english: Both these moods leave you -- the ordinary citizen -- inert.
sentences.chinese: 这两种情绪都让作为普通公民的你充满惰性。

sentences.english: So the citizen has the obligation to obey such good law.
sentences.chinese: 对于这样的良法，公民就有遵守的义务。

sentences.english: Recruiting departments shall take measures to facilitate citizens' registration for examination.
sentences.chinese: 招录机关应当采取措施，便利公民报考。

sentences.english: The government wants the European Union to permit visa-free travel for Turkish citizens.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其政府希望欧盟应当为土耳其公民免除签证。

sentences.english: The Constitution must give citizens confidence that they will have control of their own destinies .
sentences.chinese: 宪法应给公民信心，他们有权掌握自己的命运。

sentences.english: Well, was in Citizen Kane? In his documentary?
sentences.chinese: 是在《公民凯恩》里，还是在他的纪录片里？

sentences.english: And this president has even approved names of American citizens on that list.
sentences.chinese: 而且这个大总统甚至把一些美国公民也列入名单。

sentences.english: She's an American citizen but lill-es in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 她是美国公民，但居住在加拿大。

sentences.english: Unlawful search of, or intrusion into, a citizen’s residence is prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 禁止非法搜查或者非法侵入公民的住宅。

sentences.english: In a country in which many people are illiterate, this is time-consuming.
sentences.chinese: 在一个大部分公民是文盲的国家，这将是旷日持久的。

definition: right (i.e. an entitlement to sth)/(classical) power and wealth
the right to be elected/the right to stand for election
